Class OpeningGameEvaluator

java.lang.Object
engine.forPlayer.forAI.OpeningGameEvaluator
All Implemented Interfaces:
BoardEvaluator
public class OpeningGameEvaluator extends Object implements BoardEvaluator
The OpeningGameEvaluator class provides specialized board evaluation for opening positions in chess. This evaluator prioritizes opening principles such as piece development, center control, king safety, and tempo over pure material advantage. It implements the BoardEvaluator interface and follows the singleton pattern to ensure consistent evaluation throughout the chess engine.
Author:
Aaron Ho

  • Method Details

    • get

      public static OpeningGameEvaluator get()
      Returns the singleton instance of OpeningGameEvaluator.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of OpeningGameEvaluator.

    • evaluate

      public double evaluate(Board board, int depth)
      Evaluates the given board position and returns a numerical score. The evaluation considers opening-specific factors with appropriate weightings.
      Specified by:
      evaluate in interface BoardEvaluator
      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the chess board.
      depth - The search depth in the AI's thinking process.
      Returns:
      The evaluation score of the board from white's perspective.

    • score

      private double score(Player player, Board board, int depth)
      Calculates the overall positional score for a given player focusing on opening principles. Combines material, development, center control, king safety, pawn structure, mobility, piece coordination, and tempo evaluations with opening-specific weightings.
      Parameters:
      player - The player for whom the board position is being evaluated.
      board - The current state of the chess board.
      depth - The current search depth for evaluation adjustments.
      Returns:
      The evaluation score from the perspective of the specified player.

    • materialScore

      private double materialScore(Collection<Piece> playerPieces)
      Evaluates material balance with reduced weight during the opening phase. Material sacrifices for initiative are more acceptable in opening positions.
      Parameters:
      playerPieces - The collection of pieces belonging to the player.
      Returns:
      The material evaluation score.

    • developmentScore

      private double developmentScore(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates piece development which is the most critical opening consideration. Heavily penalizes undeveloped minor pieces and rewards proper development order.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose development is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The development evaluation score.

    • isCentralPosition

      private boolean isCentralPosition(int position, Piece.PieceType pieceType)
      Determines if the given position is centralized for the specified piece type. Central positions are generally favorable for piece development in the opening.
      Parameters:
      position - The board position to evaluate.
      pieceType - The type of piece being evaluated.
      Returns:
      True if the position is considered centralized for the piece type.

    • canCastle

      private boolean canCastle(Player player)
      Checks if the player retains castling rights on either side.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to check for castling capabilities.
      Returns:
      True if the player can still castle king-side or queen-side.

    • centerControlScore

      private double centerControlScore(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates center control which is fundamental to opening theory. Rewards occupation and control of central squares with pieces and pawns.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose center control is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The center control evaluation score.

    • kingSafetyScore

      private double kingSafetyScore(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates king safety which is critical during the opening phase. Prioritizes castling and penalizes king exposure in the center.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose king safety is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The king safety evaluation score.

    • evaluatePawnShield

      private double evaluatePawnShield(Player player, int kingPosition)
      Evaluates the quality of the pawn shield protecting the castled king. Counts pawns in shield positions and awards bonuses for intact formations.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose pawn shield is being evaluated.
      kingPosition - The position of the king on the board.
      Returns:
      The pawn shield evaluation score.

    • evaluateKingAttackPotential

      private double evaluateKingAttackPotential(int kingPosition, Player opponent)
      Evaluates the potential for king attacks by calculating opponent piece proximity. Awards penalties based on the attacking potential of nearby opponent pieces.
      Parameters:
      kingPosition - The position of the king being evaluated.
      opponent - The opposing player whose pieces pose attack threats.
      Returns:
      The king attack potential penalty score.

    • pawnStructureScore

      private double pawnStructureScore(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates pawn structure with emphasis on opening considerations. Analyzes center pawns, doubled pawns, isolated pawns, pawn chains, and pawn advances.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose pawn structure is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The pawn structure evaluation score.

    • evaluateCenterPawns

      private double evaluateCenterPawns(List<Piece> pawns, Alliance alliance)
      Evaluates the central pawn structure for opening control. Rewards presence of pawns on central files and supporting pawn formations.
      Parameters:
      pawns - The collection of pawns to evaluate.
      alliance - The alliance of the pawns being evaluated.
      Returns:
      The center pawn evaluation score.

    • evaluateDoubledPawns

      private double evaluateDoubledPawns(List<Piece> pawns)
      Evaluates doubled pawns which are particularly problematic in the opening. Awards severe penalties for multiple pawns on the same file.
      Parameters:
      pawns - The collection of pawns to evaluate.
      Returns:
      The doubled pawn penalty score.

    • evaluateIsolatedPawns

      private double evaluateIsolatedPawns(List<Piece> pawns)
      Evaluates isolated pawns which lack support from adjacent files. Awards higher penalties for isolated center pawns versus wing pawns.
      Parameters:
      pawns - The collection of pawns to evaluate.
      Returns:
      The isolated pawn penalty score.

    • evaluatePawnChains

      private double evaluatePawnChains(List<Piece> pawns)
      Evaluates pawn chains which provide mutual protection and structural strength. Awards bonuses for connected pawns on adjacent files.
      Parameters:
      pawns - The collection of pawns to evaluate.
      Returns:
      The pawn chain bonus score.

    • evaluatePawnAdvances

      private double evaluatePawnAdvances(List<Piece> pawns, Alliance alliance)
      Evaluates pawn advances and penalizes excessive early advances. Encourages conservative pawn play except for central files in the opening.
      Parameters:
      pawns - The collection of pawns to evaluate.
      alliance - The alliance of the pawns being evaluated.
      Returns:
      The pawn advance evaluation score.

    • mobilityScore

      private double mobilityScore(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates piece mobility with reduced weight compared to other opening factors. Considers general mobility and specific mobility for knights and bishops.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose mobility is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The mobility evaluation score.

    • pieceCoordinationScore

      private double pieceCoordinationScore(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates piece coordination and harmony in opening positions. Rewards pieces that protect each other and follow good development patterns.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose piece coordination is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The piece coordination evaluation score.

    • evaluateDevelopmentPatterns

      private double evaluateDevelopmentPatterns(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates specific good development patterns common in opening theory. Rewards fianchetto formations, connected rooks, and penalizes poorly placed knights.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose development patterns are being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The development pattern evaluation score.

    • areRooksConnected

      private boolean areRooksConnected(Collection<Piece> pieces)
      Checks if rooks are connected by being placed on the same rank. Connected rooks provide mutual protection and increased activity.
      Parameters:
      pieces - The collection of pieces to check for rook connections.
      Returns:
      True if two or more rooks are connected on the same rank.

    • tempoScore

      private double tempoScore(Player player, Board board, int depth)
      Evaluates tempo and initiative which are crucial in opening positions. Rewards attacking moves, development advantage, and initiative-gaining moves.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose tempo is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      depth - The search depth for depth-based tempo considerations.
      Returns:
      The tempo evaluation score.

    • pieceSafetyScore

      private double pieceSafetyScore(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates piece safety by detecting hanging pieces and undefended valuable pieces. Heavily penalizes pieces that can be captured for free or are inadequately defended. This is crucial in the opening to prevent tactical blunders.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose piece safety is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The piece safety evaluation score (negative values indicate unsafe pieces).

    • calculateSimpleExchange

      private int calculateSimpleExchange(Piece piece, List<Piece> attackers, List<Piece> defenders)
      Calculates the approximate material outcome of an exchange sequence. Uses simplified logic to estimate the result of a capture sequence.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece being attacked.
      attackers - List of pieces that can capture.
      defenders - List of pieces that can defend.
      Returns:
      The estimated material loss for the defending side.

    • isPieceDefended

      private boolean isPieceDefended(Piece piece, Player owner, Board board)
      Checks if a piece is defended by another piece of the same alliance. Used to determine if attacks target undefended pieces.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to check for defense.
      owner - The player who owns the piece.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      True if the piece is defended by a friendly piece.

    • countDevelopedMinorPieces

      private int countDevelopedMinorPieces(Collection<Piece> pieces, Alliance alliance)
      Counts the number of developed minor pieces for the given alliance. A piece is considered developed if it has moved from its starting rank.
      Parameters:
      pieces - The collection of pieces to count.
      alliance - The alliance of the pieces being counted.
      Returns:
      The number of developed minor pieces.

    • evaluateInitiative

      private double evaluateInitiative(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates initiative factors including space advantage and piece activity. Used for deeper search depths to consider longer-term initiative.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose initiative is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The initiative evaluation score.

    • evaluateSpaceAdvantage

      private double evaluateSpaceAdvantage(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates space advantage by counting moves into the opponent's territory. Space control contributes to initiative and attacking potential.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose space advantage is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The space advantage evaluation score.

    • evaluatePieceActivity

      private double evaluatePieceActivity(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates piece activity by counting legal moves for non-pawn pieces. Active pieces contribute to initiative and tactical opportunities.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose piece activity is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board state.
      Returns:
      The piece activity evaluation score.

    • getPawns

      private List<Piece> getPawns(Player player)
      Returns a list of pawn pieces belonging to the specified player. Utility method for pawn structure evaluation functions.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose pawns are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A list of pawn pieces belonging to the player.
